executive_summary: Somnath Kshirsagar is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 8.2%, indicating a need for improved glycemic control, alongside elevated LDL cholesterol levels and borderline blood pressure.

clinical_context.recent_events: 1 hypoglycemic event in the last 90 days

interpretation.assessment: HbA1c of 8.2% indicates inadequate diabetes management.
interpretation.plan: Initiate insulin therapy and consider referral to a diabetes educator.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level of 3.6 is above the target.
interpretation.plan: Discuss dietary changes and consider statin therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Limit alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Adopt a balanced diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins while reducing saturated fats and sugars.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
Quinoa with roasted vegetables and chickpeas
Oatmeal topped with berries and nuts
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use smaller plates to help control portion sizes and avoid second servings.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Monitor for signs of hypoglycemia, especially during exercise.

patient_goals: Reduce LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within 6 months

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.
Discuss the initiation of statin therapy for cholesterol management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid profile, and weight; adjust treatment as necessary.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, presenting with an HbA1c of 8.2%, elevated LDL, and overweight status. Recommendations include insulin therapy, dietary changes, and increased physical activity.
